phrase: To be, or not to be
Et tu, Brute?
All the world’s a stage
Call me Ishmael.
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times
source: A Tale of Two Cities (Charles Dickens)

phrase: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet
The pen is mightier than the sword
Abandon all hope, ye who enter here
Once upon a midnight dreary
In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth
All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others
So it goes
Big Brother is watching you
The lady doth protest too much, methinks
Hell is other people
Arms and the man I sing
Water, water, everywhere, nor any drop to drink
source: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner (Samuel Taylor Coleridge)

phrase: All men are created equal
Cry ‘Havoc!’ and let slip the dogs of war
Knowledge is power
Beware the Ides of March
The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves
Parting is such sweet sorrow
The course of true love never did run smooth
All that glitters is not gold
The unexamined life is not worth living
I think, therefore I am
The only thing we have to fear is fear itself
Ask not what your country can do for you
Four score and seven years ago
Give me liberty, or give me death
Workers of the world unite
The die is cast
Veni, vidi, vici
Carpe diem
The end justifies the means
History repeats itself
Time is money
Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely
The truth will set you free
All hope abandon, ye who enter here
The world is full of obvious things
source: The Hound of the Baskervilles (Arthur Conan Doyle)

phrase: The moving finger writes; and, having writ, moves on
The child is father of the man
The road less traveled
Do not go gentle into that good night
source: Do Not Go Gentle into That Good Night (Dylan Thomas)

phrase: Rage, rage against the dying of the light
source: Do Not Go Gentle into That Good Night (Dylan Thomas)

phrase: The center cannot hold
Things fall apart; the centre cannot hold
The horror! The horror!
So many things are possible just as long as you don’t know they’re impossible
All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us
source: The Fellowship of the Ring (J. R. R. Tolkien)

phrase: Not all those who wander are lost
source: The Fellowship of the Ring (J. R. R. Tolkien)

phrase: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise
Winter is coming
source: A Game of Thrones (George R. R. Martin)
